page.title: 12Ponteland Health Centre
page.content: The{Health Centre }was opened in 1971 and occupies a single storey brick building.Surgeries are provided by a team of seven doctors,(five male,two female),and five nurses.They are held twice daily on weekdays and Saturday mornings.There are 17,500 patients registered at the centre. A range of specialist facilities are offered.These include a{chiropodist, {audio-metrician,dentist,speech {therapist,dietician,family planning {clinic,and a baby clinic}with a shop for the sale of milk foods.The latter sees 300 new faces every year.Nurses will attend to minor injuries, dressings and vaccinations.If a patient is too ill to attend the clinic a doctor will visit at home, travelling a radius of up to 10 miles. A{Health Visitor}may also visit.The staff includes a team of receptionists
